page.title: 01The Land Around Pendoggett
page.content: The area is typical Cornish countryside sloping way on either side of B3314 which runs diagonally thorugh the block SW to NE. Any wooded ares are confined to sheltered valleys. Lnd use is almost totally agriulture, which is divided fairly equally between Dairying, the largest herds being around 150 heads:sheep, most farms carry a flock, beef cattle, again most farms carry a herd, Arable this predominating around Tevinnick and Tresungers farm. Tourism is the only other enterprise of any size, most farmhouses ('do') bed and breakfast during the seson, guesthouses abound in and around Port Spaac and port Gaverne. There is very little new building being undertaken, what there is is confined mainly within existing Village boundaries, though there has been a small
